comment: This professor gives awful lectures before lab. I followed up on a missing lab notebook grade, and he accused me of faking the submission receipt for no reason, which I brought up to the lab coordinator, who apologized and fixed it. He is very unhelpful at answering questions and also grades harshly with no extra feedback on how to improve.

Professor White was an okay professor for Chemistry II lab. He does seem to be a bit disorganized and not very helpful when it comes to answering questions in a helpful way. But the class was still okay because he was kind and does truly care about the students. The lab reports are very long, and he does grade them harshly sometimes.

Professor White was not bad for Chem 2 Lab. He does give long lectures in the beginning of each lab but once you start the lab, you will finish within an hour. These lab reports are long but he is willing to help out. I wouldn't mind taking him again.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor White was the worst professor I have had so far. He is rude, and takes an extremely long time to explain the procedures of each lab. He is unorganized and grades the lab assignments hard.

Okay, he was a sweet guy, not the best at instructions though, and for a lab that's not great. Luckily the labs weren't too hard, but if you think you'll need a lot of guidance, take someone else. The worst part of the class was that he would ramble for and hour before each lab.

He is very kind and understanding. He rambles directions but it is just to try to help you understand. He will answer questions and emails about all labs. He is a teacher who genuinely wants his students to do good.

Professor White is very caring. He is not too picky about the organization of your lab notebook. He will help if you ask him questions, just make sure he knows when you understand because he can over explain things sometimes. He has made orgo chem lab enjoyable. If you want a good grade, take him.

Dr. White is my favorite professor I've ever had!! I had to retake Organic chemistry + lab, and he has made the lab so easy compared to other professors. He is very forgiving, always willing to help on any questions and has a great personality. If you are scared of Organic chemistry, I would 100% recommend him!

Professor White is definitely a solid choice for chem lab, He is not super tough about the organization of your lab notebook, and is always super helpful with the calculations after experiments. He is kind of disorganized and will over explain the labs but its because he cares and wants you to do well. Just be patient and he will help a lot.

He is a really sweet guy, you just have to be really patient with him. He isn't a super tough grader, but he is a little disorganized. He often over-explains experiments or goes off on tangents, but overall he makes lab fun.

Steve is such a kind man. He wants all of his students to love and understand chemistry. He sometimes gets a little stressed out and flustered but just be patient with him. Hes really great and is so understanding of his students.

Really sweet guy and an easy grader but super disorganized. I think most of the problem was the fact that this section was online and he had no control at all. Overexplains every single question asked though, so make sure to stop him once you understand or he'll just keep talking.

I loved professor white. He is a very sweet man and really wants to help the students. He can go off on tangents during lectures but being an online class, you can just go and do something else. The experiments were very straightforward and easy to do. I got a B in my chem1151L class and that was in person. Easy A for this online class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I would 100% take him for online chem lab, not sure if I would in person. He loses his train of thought a lot and is scatterbrained, but it made me laugh and was entertaining. Hes a super easy grader. All lab answers can pretty much be found on CHEGG. The final was super easy. Take him.

Poor Dr. White is not coping well with online learning. He seems nice but he thinks the experiments are easy, which I guess they are if you have a PhD. First year chemistry student, no so much. Weirdly picky grader. I wouldn't do it again but seems like their whole chemistry dept is pitiful, so he might be the best of a bad lot.

Honestly, Dr. White is very knowledgeable in chemistry but unclear at times. Hes also a bit unorganized & will not answer your emails. Despite this, hes very funny & sweet. Hell help you in lab if you ask. If you have a good chem lecture teacher & a helpful TA you will get a good grade. Content assessments are very hard though but he drops 1.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Tough grader

comment: Chem lab is not fun no matter which way you look at it, but Dr. White makes it bearable. His quizzes are pretty tough but aren't worth much. I think he is a pretty easy grader on the lab reports, as long as you do the work. Overall, not a bad choice for lab professor, just make sure to pay attention in lecture.

I honestly cant believe people have bad things to say about him. He is the easiest grader ever. Half the time I didnt know what tf I was doing and I would receive a 92,95,98. Cant complain, I just made the work look like I knew. He didnt really know what he was doing bc it was his first time in 1212 in years, but idc bc it was an easy A!!!

I love this man. I got high As on everything because he is such an easy grader (even though he thinks he is tough) and made the class so easy. He is scattered brained, yes, but I would rather have that than someone who is a tough grader and rude (aka Nancy Kirk). If you reach out to him he will do his best to make sure youre happy with your grade

Dr. White is really quiet, so it is hard to hear his prelab lectures. He grades fairly harshly, though it is possible to make a 100 on a lab report. His quizzes for 1152 are really hard and he never gives them back, so we don't know what we did wrong. I still did well in the class, but don't plan to take him again.

Dr. White is ... Not my favorite. But compared to other CHEM1151L professors, he's probably one of the best. He's easy to deal with and explains labs (but takes forever to do so). Don't bother emailing; 9 times out of 10 he will ignore it. I know lots of people had issues with him, but most weren't his fault (COVID & chem dept did not mix well).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Overly tough grader and unorganized. Straight 100s in regular chemistry, F's on certain labs and quizzes in Chem Lab. Quizzes on labs not taken yet, unhelpful and long response times when asking questions (online or in-person), and takes him too long to explain labs. The most help was the TA, who I went to with all my questions. AVOID THIS CLASS!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Incompetent. Unreliable. Don't bother emailing him on anything, he won't respond. Don't bother registering because he grades unfairly/ inconsistently. During a pandemic, you would think he would be helpful but, he continues to be a failure as a teacher by not relaying help to his students. Whereas other lab profs help their class on the labs.

the worst prof everrrrrr. nitpicky on everything and wont give anything higher than a 99 because theres always mistakes that only he sees. takes years to respond to emails and can barely help you if you have problems. content assessments are tricky and if D2L messes your grade up he wont fix it DONT TAKE HIM!!!!!

Dr. White is the best chem lab prof at ksu. You will not find someone who is more laid back than him. Easy 100 for notebooks bc he just glances over them. I've gotten A's on all labs (i struggled to even pass with dr. kirk) He thinks he is a hard grader, but trust me he isn't! Yes he is kind of all over the place but he truly cares about your grade

Dr. White is good at explaining what needs to happen for the labs but when it comes to the tests: a complete airhead. It;s impossible to expect a response back when emailing him about anything. My grade depends on it but, he doesn't seem to care obvi. if he ignores emails from multiple students about a grading error on an assessment. Be wary.

Dr. White is one of the most disorganized professors I have ever had. He was almost impossible to get in contact with outside of class. He never gave any feedback on why we got a certain grade for our lab reports. I don't even know what I got on my final.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Dr. White was very unorganized and was very unclear with his instructions. I always felt uneasy and annoyed in his class because he doesnt really take anything seriously and could never answer my questions.
Loved Dr. White!! Although he took SOO long to explain the labs, he was so helpful during the labs. Answered any questions. Absolutely hilarious!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: this man is funny

Dr. White was a really good lab professor considering he knew a lot about what we were doing and the class is self led anyway. He can be awkward at times but you get over it. Final was so easy as long as you did the lab reports. I never got my grade back for the final but I got an A in the class so just do the labs and mind your business.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: If he is an option for CHEM 1151 Lab, take him! He works with you to make sure you understand the lab procedures and is overall a patient professor. He may seem a bit unorganized, but honestly his light hearted personality makes for an enjoyable lab class. Do your part and put in the work and you should do fine.

He's a nice guy but he has some weird aversion to giving students 100% on labs so even if you did everything perfectly he'll scrutinize until he finds some tiny mistake and mark you off for it. He also takes forever to explain easy labs that the students have already read. He also gave us at least two quizzes with nothing we could have prepared for
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Dr. White is a great choice for lab because you can tell he wants his students to do well. He may be a little unorganized, but he is a very smart guy who knows a lot about chemistry. He spends a lot of time at the beginning of class explaining the labs. He drops your lowest lab grade, and it's overall an easy class to do well in.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr. White is very sweet and unique. He took a very long time to explain the lab to make sure everyone understands the topic. He is however slow to respond and his grading is not very clear on different assignments. Overall he is a sweet man and means well!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough Grader

comment: Dr. White is a very unique man. He is very nice and willing to help but he always takes forever to answer your questions. He is very generous and kind with grading, and he wants everyone to succeed for the most part. He gives hard quizzes but one gets dropped. He has no control over the final so I hat difficulty is not his fault. Overall, good guy!

I took Mr. White for a hybrid class and I highly recommend him. Hes a little goofy, but he really cares about your grades. If you miss some quizzes online simply ask to see if he will help you out because he helped me out with 2 missed quizzes. Lab is pretty easy bc he shows you how to do It all before hand!! The content assessments are kinda hard
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is very sweet but takes forever to explain a simple lab.

It's a lab class, so you better be doing your lab reports and write-ups and if you don't show up to class, you can't make-up the lab that was supposed to be completed that day so you might as well just cry. He's a really cool dude and he'll help you with whatever you need.

Very unorganized, but a really nice guy. He explains every lab (in waaaaaay too much detail) before you do the lab, which makes it really easy. Lab sucks, but it's not his fault, but he is a pretty easy lab professor.

TAKE HIM FOR CHEM LAB!! He is a little weird at first but he will give you all the answers before your lab. I made As on all of them and I am not good at chemistry. The labs will take up the whole tim because he explains everything but don't ignore him or get annoyed because he is giving you all the answers! & easy grader!

He's an easy grader but spent the first day going over the syllabus and took and hour and a half to do it. Every class after that wasn't much different, he spends a good amount of time going over what we're about to do and often gets sidetracked. He does grade lab reports easily but has some pretty difficult quizzes and you can't use your lab book
Scatterbrained as can be. Super nice guy, gave our class all the answers in the 30 minutes he spends taking before each lab. Easy to talk to and willing to help. Would def take again.

Very tough grader on lab reports, and he takes a lot of time to go over the information that we already had to read in our lab manuals. He also is very hard to follow and doesn't make sense, but he tries.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is literally so flustered all the time. You ask him one question and he goes on and on about trees or something random. He does not make things clear at all. He also talks forever when all you need is a quick explanation & then get on with the lab.  He needs to focus. Take this class only if you want to spend all 2 hours and 45 minutes in class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. White is probably the goofiest and most scatter-brained professor Ive ever had. He's very silly (and his character is quite comical). He was VERY helpful during labs and was willing to assist you. I got A's on every lab, easily. My only complaint is that he spent way too much time going over the lab, thus, taking away from lab time.
very very helpful will stay after lab to help.
Very funny guy! kinda scatterbrained, but knows what he's talking about. Easy grader, not too picky on lab reports and EXTREMELY helpful.

White is the easiest Chem 1151L teacher out of all of them. Clear grading. He talks way too much before the labs, but bearable!  Content Assessments tough but doable. Final exam changed this semester and was easy! Easy AB class. Grade consists of: Lab Notebook, Lab Report, Cont Ass., Pre Lab Quizzes, Professionalism , and Final. Got an A in class

The number one complaint i have about White is he does not like to answer emails. It was like pulling teeth to get him to help me. The Content Assessments were extremely hard and some of the information we never learned. He doesn't teach anything or explain things thoroughly. He's also very awkward. If you aren't great at chem, AVOID him.

I had him for Chem 1151L and although his classes were long he does a good job demonstrating how to do the lab and helps you throughout filling out your lab notebook. As all lab teachers, you must show up to every class. I would recommend him for a lab teacher.

Professor White reminds me of the dad off of "Honey I Shrunk The Kids". He is extremely weird and awkward, and sometimes he does not know when to stop talking. Aside from his personality, Chem 1151 Lab was bearable because of him. He makes it clear what he wants on lab reports, and although he can be a strict grader, I came out with an A.
Helps with lab, but grades harshly on lab manual. Every time you cross something out, he takes a point off.

LOVE him. He's kinda awkward, but he tries to crack jokes and keep the mood light. SO willing to help- will literally give you the answers if you have questions. Talks for 30+ minutes before you start the lab, which I found helpful because he would give answers to lab report ?s. Will drop lowest grades! Take him!

OK, this guy is kinda weird. But he is hilarious and very helpful in lab. Talks for 30-45 minutes before you actually begin the experiment. Will drop your lowest test, quiz, and lab grade. He wants you to succeed. Online assessments every other week (when you aren't in lab) are difficult, but he allows 3 hours to take them.

Lab was easy and fun. There are plenty of grade boosters, and Prof White will drop lowest grades from  each of the quizzes, assessments, and labs. Follow instructions carefully in the Lab, and ask questions from Prof White because he is willing to help.

took him during summer semester. expected to be hard. he is very nice, and funny. Made easy A in this course even with a hard final. He has quizes that are straight from the lab manual on stuff u've learned already and his sarcasm made our 8am class worth while.

I took this course durring summer semester and i loved it. he did have like 7 quizes and they were straight out of the lab manual on stuff we learned already. I made a A on every lab report. He is very helpful and will help you on questions from the report. He is funny, well atleast he thinks he is and laughs at his own jokes. makes 8am class fun

Professor White is a good professor and he wasn't hard at all. He was pretty awkward but in a funny way. The only complaint is that sometimes he confuses you even more when you ask questions, so I wouldn't recommend asking anything.

Professor White is very unique, but such a great prof! He is kinda awkward, but is so willing to help and answer any questions you might have. He is one of my favorite lab professors so far! Take him if you can.

Professor White's personality made the lab more interesting. He is really awkward and laughs at his own jokes historically. He was very helpful in the labs.  Make sure you check your sig figs every lab report. I highly recommend him!

He was my lab teacher, very cooky typical chemistry teacher but a truly great guy he is very sweet and patient with his students I did not feel like his grading was hard because everything is literally step by step laid out exactly how to do it and you can ask him if your right and he WILL tell you & help you fix anything..  TAKE HIM!!

dr.white is a kooky professor and his personality makes the labs fun and confusing at the same time. the quizzes were horrible, as they were based on the labs 2 weeks prior; he never told us what was on each quiz. MAKE SURE YOU DO THE LAB NOTEBOOK CORRECTLY!! he has really high standards for it!!

He was my lab professor. Very awkward but so very nice, would pretty much explain everything before hand. If you had a question with the calculations he would sit there and help you until you understood. Yes, he grades the reports hard, but if you don't know how to write a proper lab report how are you in college? I loved him. Best lab professor.

Great professor. A stickler for sig figs but if you pay attention and do the labs ahead of time you'll be fine. Very relaxed funny guy. Very smart, knows his stuff. I'd recommend him if you don't want to be stressed out about lab.
Very slack teacher but knew his stuff.

what to say.... rediculous grading scale... i got 20 points counted off because i did not put the degrees sign on an alcohol. this was definitely my hardest class an i am an all A's student. he took our lab manuals at the end of the semester and did not give us a grade when he returned them, he made up our grades at the end. i got an A. good luck!!

This one is quite strange and his grading scale is beyond stupid but I liked him. This was my most stressful classes and it's a lab. He is beyond strict with his grading process. If you are not good at Significant Figures please don't take him. That's how I got my B. He will try and help you though when you need it.

Dr White is a unique sense of humor and overall good lab professor.  Watch sig figs!!!! He will crush your grade if you don't.  Want to do well? Ask him how many sig figs you need for each part of the report even if u think u know.  Don't fill out lab sheet until u r absolutely done unless u r absolutely done, they need to be perfect, no crossing o

Doctor White is difficult to understand at best. Hope for a good TA who can explain things to you. He grades strictly but know your sig figs and you will be alright. Utilize the chem lab to make sure your lab reports are perfect before turning them in. It's not so bad! I got an A, and if I can do it you can do it!

This lab teacer is very frustrating. He is a strict grader with lab reports so make sure they are perfect and on time!He claims to not make any decisions & is not a good leader.He is very smart but need be clearer & more accessible to students. Don't let his quirks fool you & be sure to document and issues. The final was hard!

I took Prof. White for Chem Lab and he is a strange man, but sometimes we need strange to get by.. He answers your questions, and laughs at the strangest things, but he's worth taking.. He didn't make the class any harder and was fair to all of us.. If you respect him and stay open minded you'll def. pass!!

Dr. White is so sweet. He does come across as a strange cookie initially, but hang with him and it will be fine. He's very helpful and funny! Grading is fair. Watch your sig figs! I made high 95's on all my labs. So it can be done! PL sessions are OK. Somewhat helpful depending on the TA you get. Quizzes are easy too.

Prof White is hilarious. Yeah, he's crazy, but it makes lab so much more entertaining. I stayed after lab every single week for about 10 minutes and he will pretty much give you all the answers for the lab write-up. I recommend using your partner, and doing the prelab quizzes together. The department guy writes them, and they can be ridiculous.

Yes, hes strange, but hes great! If youre nice & respect him it'll reflect on your grade. Drops lowest lab & quiz. Quizzes arent made by him  but the department. So, they are tricky. Overall they dont count that much. I made an A with a failing quiz avg. Final is comprehensive. White out mistakes on lab reports, he'll take off. Give him a chance!

Took him for the lab. He's nice, but just a little on the strange side. His thoughts are pretty scattered, pre-lab takes FOREVER and nobody listens because he just rambles.  Halfway through the semester he started giving quizzes that were extremely difficult, almost the entire class failed them. If you can take another professor, do.

Pre- labs are extremley long and painful. He is an okay professor but talks forever before getting to the point. He easily loses assignments which means he may also lose your grade. Take someone else if you can.

This teacher was good but kind of wierd. He answers a one word question with a paragraph. He always laughs when you ask a question and takes random points off for sig. figs. After three or so labs you can get used to his grading technique and start making high Bs or As on the lab reports. I made an A and it wasn't that time consuming.

Very helpful in the labs. Other students were too quick to judge him, if you are honest and ask him questions he will go out of his way to help. This is my second time taking him and I'd do it again if I could

It's a miracle anyone passed this class! He took AT LEAST 30 minutes out of every lab to explain the procedure (on which many of us were still confused by the time we started).His grading system was RIDICULOUS, I can't even count how many times i lost points for something he refused to explain. Overall,I would NOT recommend him.

He's a nice guy, but he's very incompetent as a Professor. Makes mistakes when grading and as it's been said he does have the potential to lose assignments. Probably grades the hardest of all lab professors. Avoid if you can, but if you have to take him just pray your paper isn't the one that gets lost.

Professor White is the man!! I had him for 1211 and 1212 Lab. He comes off extraordinarily weird, but he's such a goofy guy. If you have a question about your results, data, and about how to answer a question, he'll give you the answer! lol that's i got through the labs and it was great! he's awesome!

Really poor lab professor.  Squirrely little man with a nervous giggle.  Extremely nit picky with grading labs, and often will take points off for stuff he had previously OK'd (like answering questions on the back of the sheet rather than on additional paper). Makes it clear he does not enjoy teaching labs.

I took him for lab and he really didn't help me when I had a question. The day of the final he was paranoid about students cheating. You cant really read his writing when you get your labs back, not the best lab professor. He likes to talk for about 30mins before you can actually start on the lab
I had him for chemlab. If you want to be sure where your grade is coming from, do not take his class. Never gave a quiz, but didn't know what to study for the final.
very mundane

This lab professor is quite awful.  He is seemingly normal for the first couple of weeks of lab, but then he kind of goes nuts thinking the students are all cheating.  A simple question takes 10 minutes to answer. I don't recommend this teacher at all.  His teaching style is off the wall and if you struggle then you will need your class' help.

If you have the option of NOT taking him. do it. ONLY professor Ive hated in kennesaw. First: Hes parttime meaning he doesnt have office hours + He doesnt answer emails ( he even tells u he doesnt) so if u need help, you cant get it. He loses assignments, and his grading is sparatic as hell. One day ill lose 5 points for sf another its only 1.AVOID
No Comments

If you have a clue on what is going on in class then you should not have a problem in lab.  Preparation before the lab is a must in order to understand the pre-lab.  He doesn't believe in busy work, so you go in do your thing and go out.
he was one confused professor...he couldnt explain things simply. lab is easy but he talked too much and confusedb u even more
He is ok...give about 5 pop quizzes before the lab.  Lab was ok but kind of weird. he is nice though.
SOMEONE PLEASE RATE THIS PROFESSOR...THANKS
